chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
LiftLiftFuse

Premises:
Record LiftLiftFuse (T : Type) (H : Lift T) : Prop := Build_LiftLiftFuse { lift_lift_fuse : forall (t : T) (k s wk ws : nat), s <= k <= s + ws -> lift wk k (lift ws s t) = lift (wk + ws) s t } Arguments LiftLiftFuse {T}%type_scope {H} Arguments Build_LiftLiftFuse [T]%type_scope _ _%function_scope
Build_LiftLiftFuse : forall (T : Type) (H : Lift T), (forall (t : T) (k s wk ws : nat), s <= k <= s + ws -> lift wk k (lift ws s t) = lift (wk + ws) s t) -> LiftLiftFuse
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
BinPosDef.Pos.iter = fun (A : Type) (f : A -> A) => fix iter_fix (x : A) (n : BinNums.positive) {struct n} : A := match n with | BinNums.xI n' => f (iter_fix (iter_fix x n') n') | BinNums.xO n' => iter_fix (iter_fix x n') n' | BinNums.xH => f x end : forall A : Type, (A -> A) -> A -> BinNums.positive -> A Arguments BinPosDef.Pos.iter {A}%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%positive_scope
Nat.le_gt_cases : forall n m : nat, n <= m \/ m < n
Nat.eq_equiv = RelationClasses.eq_equivalence : RelationClasses.Equivalence eq
Init.Nat.log2 = fun n : nat => Init.Nat.log2_iter (Init.Nat.pred n) 0 1 0 : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.log2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.div2 = fix div2 (n : nat) : nat := match n with | S (S n') => S (div2 n') | _ => 0 end : nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div2 _%nat_scope
Init.Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
BinPos.Pos.iter_succ : forall (p : BinNums.positive) (A : Type) (f : A -> A) (x : A), BinPos.Pos.iter f x (BinPos.Pos.succ p) = f (BinPos.Pos.iter f x p)
Nat.eq_le_incl : forall n m : nat, n = m -> n <= m
LiftVar_idx = {| lift_var := fun w k x : nat => if le_gt_dec k x as s return ((if s then w + x else x) = (if s then w + x else x)) then eq_refl else eq_refl |} : LiftVar
Inductive comparison : Set := Eq : comparison | Lt : comparison | Gt : comparison
gt = fun n m : nat => m < n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments gt (_ _)%nat_scope
Fin.rect2 : forall P : forall n : nat, Fin.t n -> Fin.t n -> Type, (forall n : nat, P (S n) Fin.F1 Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (f : Fin.t n), P (S n) Fin.F1 (Fin.FS f)) -> (forall (n : nat) (f : Fin.t n), P (S n) (Fin.FS f) Fin.F1) -> (forall (n : nat) (f g : Fin.t n), P n f g -> P (S n) (Fin.FS f) (Fin.FS g)) -> forall (n : nat) (a b : Fin.t n), P n a b
subst = fun (V T : Type) (Subst0 : Subst V T) => let (subst) := Subst0 in subst : forall V T : Type, Subst V T -> V -> nat -> T -> T Arguments subst {V T}%type_scope {Subst} _ _%nat_scope
VectorDef.nil : forall A : Type, VectorDef.t A 0
Nat.log2_up_le_mono : forall a b : nat, a <= b -> Nat.log2_up a <= Nat.log2_up b
Record Formula (T : Type) : Type := Build_Formula { Flhs : EnvRing.PExpr T; Fop : RingMicromega.Op2; Frhs : EnvRing.PExpr T } Arguments RingMicromega.Formula _%type_scope Arguments RingMicromega.Build_Formula [T]%type_scope
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.bits_above_log2 : forall a n : nat, Nat.log2 a < n -> Nat.testbit a n = false
ByteVector.ByteNil = Vector.nil Ascii.ascii : ByteVector.ByteVector 0
Nat.add_lt_mono_l : forall n m p : nat, n < m < -> p + n < p + m
Nat.ones_spec_high : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> Nat.testbit (Nat.ones n) m = false
Nat.lt_1_2 = (fun lemma : 2 = 2 => Morphisms.Reflexive_partial_app_morphism (Morphisms.subrelation_proper Nat.lt_wd tt (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) (Morphisms.subrelation_respectful (Morphisms.subrelation_refl eq) Morphisms.iff_flip_impl_subrelation))) (Morphisms.reflexive_proper_proxy RelationClasses.Equivalence_Reflexive 1) 2 2 lemma) Nat.two_succ (Nat.lt_succ_diag_r 1) : 1 < 2
Inductive Z : Set := Z0 : BinNums.Z | Zpos : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z | Zneg : BinNums.positive -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinNums.Zpos _%positive_scope Arguments BinNums.Zneg _%positive_scope
Inductive between (P : nat -> Prop) (k : nat) : nat -> Prop := bet_emp : between P k k | bet_S : forall l : nat, between P k l -> P l -> between P k (S l) Arguments between _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope Arguments bet_emp _%function_scope _%nat_scope Arguments bet_S _%function_scope (_ _)%nat_scope
ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker = fun (f : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z)) (w : list ZMicromega.ZArithProof) => Tauto.tauto_checker ZMicromega.Zunsat ZMicromega.Zdeduce ZMicromega.normalise ZMicromega.negate (fun cl : list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z * unit) => ZMicromega.ZChecker (List.map fst cl)) f w : Tauto.BFormula (RingMicromega.Formula BinNums.Z) -> list ZMicromega.ZArithProof -> bool Arguments ZMicromega.ZTautoChecker _ _%list_scope
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Nat.ldiff_spec : forall a b n : nat, Nat.testbit (Nat.ldiff a b) n = (Nat.testbit a n && negb (Nat.testbit b n))%bool
